types.name: American Lager
types.description: Full, Light, Balanced beer. THe American standard, basically water that get's you drunk.

types.name: Pilsner
types.description: Very light, distinct hops. Lighter then American Lager.

types.name: Bock
types.description: Strong, rich, toasty body.  bottom fermenting lager that generally takes extra months of lagering (cold storage) to smooth out such a strong brew

types.name: Pale Ale
types.description: So called because they are brewed with more lightly roasted malts, pale ales typically have a more equal malt-to-hop balance.

types.name: Barley Wine
types.description: Barley wine is a style of strong ale, implied to be as potent as wine, usually containing more than 6% alcohol by volume and traditionally as much as 11%

types.name: Stout and Porter
types.description: Dark beer made using roasted malt or roasted barley, hops, water and yeast. Stouts were traditionally the generic term for the strongest or stoutest porters, typically 7% or 8%,
